Q63.question:
Which of the following statements is closest to your view? Choose Statement 1 or Statement 2.
Statement 1: It is important that as an independent nation, we finance development from our own resources, even if it means paying more taxes.
Statement 2: We should use external loans for the development of the country, even if it increases our indebtedness to foreign countries and institutions.
Q63.description: Q63. Finance development from own resources vs use external loans.

Q64A.question:
Which of the following statements is closest to your view? Choose Statement 1 or Statement 2.
Statement 1: When other countries give loans or development assistance to [Botswana], they should enforce strict requirements on how the funds are spent.
Statement 2: When other countries give [Botswana] loans or development assistance, they should allow our government to make its own decisions about how to use the resources.
Q64A.description: Q64a. Loans tied to strict requirements by lenders vs government decides how to spend loans.

Q64B.question:
Which of the following statements is closest to your view? Choose Statement 1 or Statement 2.
Statement 1: When other countries give loans or development assistance to [Botswana], they should enforce strict requirements to make sure our government promotes democracy and respects human rights.
Statement 2: Even if other countries give [Botswana] loans or development assistance, our government should make its own decisions about democracy and human rights.
Q64B.description: Q64b. Loans tied to promotion of democracy and human rights vs government decides about democracy and human rights.

Q65A.question: To your knowledge, does China give loans or development assistance to our country's government, or haven't you had a chance to hear about this?
Q65A.description: Q65a. Country receives loans or development assistance from China

Q65B.question: Do you think that our government is required to repay China for the loans and development assistance it provides to [Botswana], or haven't you heard enough to say?
Q65B.description: Q65b. Government required to repay China for loans.

Q65C.question: Do you think our government has borrowed too much money from China, or haven't you heard enough to say?
Q65C.description: Q64c. Government borrowed too much money from China

Q65D.question: When the government of China gives loans or development assistance to [Botswana], do you think they put more requirements or fewer requirements on our government compared to other donor countries, or haven't you heard enough to say?
Q65D.description: Q65d. Requirements on loans and assistance from China.

values.2: About the same number of requirements

Q66.question:
Which of the following statements is closest to your view? Choose Statement 1 or Statement 2.
Statement 1: In order to develop, our country must rely on trade with the rest of the world, including by opening our borders to foreign imports.
Statement 2: In order to develop, our country must rely on local production and protect local producers from foreign competition.
Q66.description: Q66. Open trade for development vs protection of local producers.

Q67.question:
Which of the following statements is closest to your view? Choose Statement 1 or Statement 2.
Statement 1: The government should only allow citizens and companies of our own country to trade in consumer goods, even if this means we will have fewer goods or higher prices.
Statement 2: The government should continue to permit foreigners and foreign corporations to set up retail shops in this country to ensure we have a wide choice of low-cost consumer goods.
Q67.description: Q67. Limit trade in consumer goods to nationals vs allow foreigners to trade

Q68.question:
Which of the following statements is closest to your view? Choose Statement 1 or Statement 2.
Statement 1: Communities are stronger when they are made up of people from different ethnic groups, races, or religions.
Statement 2: Communities are stronger when they are made up of people who are similar to each other, that is, people from the same ethnic group, race, or religion.
Q68.description: Q68. Diverse communities stronger vs similar communities stronger.

Q69A.question: In your opinion, which of the following countries, if any, would be the best model for the future development of our country, or is there some other country in Africa or elsewhere, that should be our model?
Q69A.description: Q69a. Best model for the future development

values.3: Former colonial power, i.e Britain, France, or Portugal
values.7: We should follow our own country's model

Q69B.question: How much influence do you think China's economic activities in [Botswana] have on our economy, or haven't you heard enough to say?
Q69B.description: Q69b. Influence of China on country

Q70A.question:
In general, do you think that the economic and political influence of each of the following organizations on [Botswana] is mostly positive, mostly negative, or haven't you heard enough to say?
African Union
Q70A.description: Q70a. Influence of organization: African Union

Q70B.question:
In general, do you think that the economic and political influence of each of the following organizations on [Botswana] is mostly positive, mostly negative, or haven't you heard enough to say?
[Regional Economic Community eg. SADC]

Q70C.question:
In general, do you think that the economic and political influence of each of the following organizations on [Botswana] is mostly positive, mostly negative, or haven't you heard enough to say?
United Nations agencies
Q70C.description: Q70c. Influence of organization: United Nations agencies.

Q70D.question: And what about the following countries? Do you think that the economic and political influence of each of the following countries on [Botswana] is mostly positive, mostly negative, or haven't you heard enough to say? [Former Colonial Power eg. Britain]

Q70E.question: And what about the following countries? Do you think that the economic and political influence of each of the following countries on [Botswana] is mostly positive, mostly negative, or haven't you heard enough to say? China

Q70F.question: And what about the following countries? Do you think that the economic and political influence of each of the following countries on [Botswana] is mostly positive, mostly negative, or haven't you heard enough to say? United States
Q70F.description: Q70f. Influence of country: United States.

Q70G.question: And what about the following countries? Do you think that the economic and political influence of each of the following countries on [Botswana] is mostly positive, mostly negative, or haven't you heard enough to say? Regional Superpower
Q70G.description: Q70g. Influence of country: Regional Superpower.

Q70H.question: And what about the following countries? Do you think that the economic and political influence of each of the following countries on [Botswana] is mostly positive, mostly negative, or haven't you heard enough to say? Russia

Q71.question: In thinking about the future of the next generation in our country, which of these international languages, if any, do you think is most important for young people to learn?
Q71.description: Q71. Most important languages for next generation to learn

values.0: None of these/No international language needed

Q81.question: Let's go back to talking about you. What is your ethnic community, cultural group or tribe?
Q81.description: Q81. Ethnic community, cultural group or tribe

values.9990: [Ghanaian] only or doesn't think in those terms

Q82A.question: How often, if ever, are ____s [R's Ethnic Group] treated unfairly by the government?

Q82B.question: Let us suppose that you had to choose between being a [Ghanaian] and being a [R's Ethnic Group]. Which of the following statements best expresses your feelings?

values.2: I feel more (R's ethnic group) than [Ghanaian]
values.3: I feel equally [Ghanaian] and (R's ethnic group)
values.4: I feel more [Ghanaian] than (R's ethnic group)

Q82C.question: Do you feel comfortable: speaking your mother tongue in public?
Q82C.description: Q82c. Comfortable: speaking mother tongue in public

Q82D.question: Do you feel comfortable: wearing your traditional or cultural dress in public?
Q82D.description: Q82d. Comfortable: wearing traditional or cultural dress in public.

Q83.question: Generally speaking, would you say that most people can be trusted or that you must be very careful in dealing with people?
Q83.description: Q83. Most people can be trusted

Q84A.question: In the past year, how often, if ever, have you personally been treated unfairly by other [Ghanaians] based on: your economic status, that is, how rich or poor you are?
Q84A.description: Q84a. Experienced unfair treatment based on economic status.

Q84B.question: In the past year, how often, if ever, have you personally been treated unfairly by other [Batswana] based on: your religion?
Q84B.description: Q84b. Experienced unfair treatment based on religion.

Q84C.question: In the past year, how often, if ever, have you personally been treated unfairly by other [Ghanaian] based on: your ethnicity?
Q84C.description: Q84c. Experienced unfair treatment based on ethnicity.

Q85.question: [Ghanaians] are very diverse. They come from different religions, ethnic groups, political parties, and economic and social backgrounds. Overall, would you say that there is more that unites all [Ghanaians] as one people, or more that divides them?
Q85.description: Q85. Unity of people in country

Q86A.question: For each of the following types of people, please tell me whether you would like having people from this group as neighbours, dislike it, or not care: People of a different religion.
Q86A.description: Q86a. Neighbours: people of different religion

Q86B.question: For each of the following types of people, please tell me whether you would like having people from this group as neighbours, dislike it, or not care: People from other ethnic groups.
Q86B.description: Q86b. Neighbours: people of different ethnicity

Q86C.question: For each of the following types of people, please tell me whether you would like having people from this group as neighbours, dislike it, or not care: Homosexuals.

Q86D.question: For each of the following types of people, please tell me whether you would like having people from this group as neighbours, dislike it, or not care: Immigrants or foreign workers.
Q86D.description: Q86d. Neighbours: immigrants and foreign workers

Q86E.question: For each of the following types of people, please tell me whether you would like having people from this group as neighbours, dislike it, or not care: People who support a different political party
Q86E.description: Q86e. Neighbours: people who support a different political party.

Q98B.question: How often, if ever, are ____s [Respondent's religious group] treated unfairly by government?
Q98B.description: Q98b. Religious groups treated unfairly by government
